error.signature: fatal: ref HEAD is not a symbolic ref
error.regex: (?i)fatal:.*(?:not a symbolic ref|symbolic-ref.*failed|cannot create symbolic ref)

verdict.summary: HEAD is in a detached state (pointing directly to a commit hash instead of a branch name) and an operation that requires a branch reference fails. Common in CI environments, after checkout of a tag or specific commit.

dead_ends.action: Editing .git/HEAD directly to point to a non-existent branch
dead_ends.why_fails: Setting HEAD to a branch that does not exist causes 'fatal: bad object HEAD' or 'fatal: not a valid object name' errors on most git commands

dead_ends.action: Running git branch -m to rename the current branch while in detached HEAD
dead_ends.why_fails: There is no current branch to rename when HEAD is detached; the command fails with 'fatal: Not a valid object name'

workarounds.action: Attach HEAD to a branch with git checkout or git switch
workarounds.how: Run git checkout main (or any existing branch) to reattach HEAD. If you want to keep current changes, create a new branch first: git checkout -b my-new-branch.

workarounds.action: Use git symbolic-ref to manually set HEAD
workarounds.how: git symbolic-ref HEAD refs/heads/main â€” this directly sets HEAD to point to the main branch. Ensure the branch exists first.

leads_to.condition: when HEAD is set to a non-existent reference
when the detached HEAD state is the underlying cause

preceded_by.condition: when checking out a tag or commit creates a detached HEAD

frequently_confused_with.distinction: symbolic-ref-failed is a fatal error when an operation requires a branch; detached-head is the warning shown upon entering detached state
